title.narrative: OUTPUT 6.3: Communication for Development (C4D) - COMMUNICATION FOR DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: By 2024, Communities adopt evidence-informed behavior necessary for child survival, development and protection., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, children, especially the poorest, the most excluded and those affected by crisis, have access to child-sensitive and shock- responsive social services, benefit from positive community practices and are empowered to be agents of change within their communities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, Communities adopt evidence-informed behavior necessary for child survival, development and protection.

description.narrative: One key achievement this year was the diversification of platforms and networks to inform, engage and encourage children, adolescents, youth and families to participate in the development of their community. More than 22 million people were exposed to prevention messages and essential family practices, to help them make better decisions for their family, via face-to-face community engagement, through a network of more than 25,000 Community Action Cells, the media, SMS, social media and the private sector. 1,3 million;proactively;shared concerns and asked questions through;feedback mechanisms supported by UNICEF and more than 655,000 took actions;as agent of change in their community.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2021
